alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 3:49PM EDT until September 24 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Cecil County. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EDT this evening, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, minor shoreline flooding begins near Chesapeake City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two and a half to three feet above normal. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 5:51 PM. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 6:43 PM. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 6:19 PM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
